content:
IssuedSecurityTokenParameters Class

In this Article

Represents the parameters for a security token issued in a Federated security scenario.

Syntax

Declaration

public class IssuedSecurityTokenParameters : System.ServiceModel.Security.Tokens.SecurityTokenParameters

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • System.ServiceModel.Security.Tokens.SecurityTokenParameters
  • IssuedSecurityTokenParameters

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
,
Clone()
,
InclusionMode
,
MatchesKeyIdentifierClause(SecurityToken,SecurityKeyIdentifierClause,SecurityTokenReferenceStyle)
,
ReferenceStyle
,
RequireDerivedKeys

Remarks

This class is a collection of token properties and methods, and is used in creating security binding elements and tokens.

Constructors summary

IssuedSecurityTokenParameters()

Initializes a new instance of the IssuedSecurityTokenParameters class.
IssuedSecurityTokenParameters(IssuedSecurityTokenParameters)

Initializes a new instance of the IssuedSecurityTokenParameters class.
IssuedSecurityTokenParameters(String)

Initializes a new instance of the IssuedSecurityTokenParameters class using the specified token type.
IssuedSecurityTokenParameters(String,EndpointAddress)

Initializes a new instance of the IssuedSecurityTokenParameters class using the specified token type and issuer address.
IssuedSecurityTokenParameters(String,EndpointAddress,Binding)

Initializes a new instance of the IssuedSecurityTokenParameters class using the specified token type, issuer address and issuer binding.

Properties summary

AdditionalRequestParameters

Gets a collection of additional request parameters
ClaimTypeRequirements

Gets a collection of claim type requirements.
DefaultMessageSecurityVersion

Gets or sets the default set of security specifications versions.
HasAsymmetricKey

Gets a value that indicates whether the issued token has an asymmetric key.
IssuerAddress

Gets or sets the token issuer's address.
IssuerBinding

Gets or sets the token issuer's binding, to be used by the client.
IssuerMetadataAddress

Gets or sets the token issuer's metadata address.
KeySize

Gets or sets the issued token key size.
KeyType

Gets or sets the issued token key type.
SupportsClientAuthentication

When implemented, gets a value that indicates whether the token supports client authentication.
SupportsClientWindowsIdentity

When implemented, gets a value that indicates whether the token supports a Windows identity for authentication.
SupportsServerAuthentication

When implemented, gets a value that indicates whether the token supports server authentication.
TokenType

Gets or sets the issued token type.
UseStrTransform

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the issued token parameter uses STR transform.

Methods summary

CloneCore()

Clones another instance of this instance of the class.
CreateKeyIdentifierClause(SecurityToken,SecurityTokenReferenceStyle)

Creates a key identifier clause for a token.
CreateRequestParameters(MessageSecurityVersion,SecurityTokenSerializer)

Creates a collection of issued token request parameter XML elements that get included in the request sent by the client to the security token service.
InitializeSecurityTokenRequirement(SecurityTokenRequirement)

When implemented, initializes a security token requirement based on the properties set on the IssuedSecurityTokenParameters.
ToString()

Displays a text representation of this instance of the class.

Constructors

  • IssuedSecurityTokenParameters()

    Initializes a new instance of the IssuedSecurityTokenParameters class.

    public IssuedSecurityTokenParameters ();

    Remarks

    The new instance property values are set to their defaults:

    • InclusionMode is set to SecurityTokenInclusionMode.

    • ReferenceStyle is set to SecurityTokenReferenceStyle.

    • RequireDerivedKeys is set to true.

  • IssuedSecurityTokenParameters(IssuedSecurityTokenParameters)

    Initializes a new instance of the IssuedSecurityTokenParameters class.

    protected IssuedSecurityTokenParameters (System.ServiceModel.Security.Tokens.IssuedSecurityTokenParameters other);

    Parameters

    • other
      IssuedSecurityTokenParameters

      The other instance of this class.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      other is null.

    Remarks

    The new instance property values are set to the corresponding values in other.

  • IssuedSecurityTokenParameters(String)

    Initializes a new instance of the IssuedSecurityTokenParameters class using the specified token type.

    public IssuedSecurityTokenParameters (string tokenType);

    Parameters

    • tokenType
      String

      The token type.

    Remarks

    The new instance property values are set to their defaults:

    • InclusionMode is set to SecurityTokenInclusionMode.

    • ReferenceStyle is set to SecurityTokenReferenceStyle.

    • RequireDerivedKeys is set to true.

    • TokenType is set to tokenType.

  • IssuedSecurityTokenParameters(String,EndpointAddress)

    Initializes a new instance of the IssuedSecurityTokenParameters class using the specified token type and issuer address.

    public IssuedSecurityTokenParameters (string tokenType, System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress issuerAddress);

    Parameters

    • tokenType
      String

      The token type.

    • issuerAddress
      EndpointAddress

      The address of the endpoint that issues the token.

    Remarks

    The new instance property values are set to their defaults:

    • InclusionMode is set to SecurityTokenInclusionMode.

    • ReferenceStyle is set to SecurityTokenReferenceStyle.

    • RequireDerivedKeys is set to true.

    • TokenType is set to tokenType.

    • IssuerAddress is set to issuerAddress.

  • IssuedSecurityTokenParameters(String,EndpointAddress,Binding)

    Initializes a new instance of the IssuedSecurityTokenParameters class using the specified token type, issuer address and issuer binding.

    public IssuedSecurityTokenParameters (string tokenType, System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress issuerAddress, System.ServiceModel.Channels.Binding issuerBinding);

    Parameters

    • tokenType
      String

      The token type.

    • issuerAddress
      EndpointAddress

      The address of the endpoint that issues the token.

    • issuerBinding
      Binding

      The binding of the issuer.

    Remarks

    The new instance property values are set to their defaults:

    • InclusionMode is set to SecurityTokenInclusionMode.

    • ReferenceStyle is set to SecurityTokenReferenceStyle.

    • RequireDerivedKeys is set to true.

    • TokenType is set to tokenType.

    • IssuerAddress is set to issuerAddress.

    • IssuerBinding is set to issuerBinding.

Properties

  • AdditionalRequestParameters

    Gets a collection of additional request parameters

    public System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection<System.Xml.XmlElement> AdditionalRequestParameters { get; }

    Property Value

    • Collection<XmlElement>

      A stem.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection`1 of type XmlElement that holds the additional request parameters.

  • ClaimTypeRequirements

    Gets a collection of claim type requirements.

    public System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection<System.ServiceModel.Security.Tokens.ClaimTypeRequirement> ClaimTypeRequirements { get; }

    Property Value

    • Collection<ClaimTypeRequirement>

      A stem.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection`1 of type ClaimTypeRequirement that holds the additional claim type requirements.

    Remarks

    In a federated scenario, services state the requirements on incoming credentials. For example, the incoming credentials must possess a certain set of claim types. Each ClaimTypeRequirement in the returned collection specifies the types of required and optional claims expected to appear in a federated credential.

    A claim type requirement consists of the URI of the claim type requested in the issued token along with a Boolean parameter that indicates whether that claim type is required in the issued token or is optional.

  • DefaultMessageSecurityVersion

    Gets or sets the default set of security specifications versions.

    public System.ServiceModel.MessageSecurityVersion DefaultMessageSecurityVersion { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • MessageSecurityVersion

      A MessageSecurityVersion that represents the default set of security specifications versions.

  • HasAsymmetricKey

    Gets a value that indicates whether the issued token has an asymmetric key.

    protected override bool HasAsymmetricKey { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the issued token has an asymmetric key; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    Asymmetric keys are used in public-key cryptography, which uses two keys, a public key and a private key, which are related mathematically. The public key is distributed widely, but the private key is kept secret. In public-key cryptography, there is no requirement to exchange a common key.

  • IssuerAddress

    Gets or sets the token issuer's address.

    public System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress IssuerAddress { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • EndpointAddress

      The EndpointAddress of the token issuer.

  • IssuerBinding

    Gets or sets the token issuer's binding, to be used by the client.

    public System.ServiceModel.Channels.Binding IssuerBinding { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Binding

      The Binding of the token issuer, to be used by the client.

    Remarks

    Note that this property does not need to be populated on the service, because it is only accessed by the client.

  • IssuerMetadataAddress

    Gets or sets the token issuer's metadata address.

    public System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress IssuerMetadataAddress { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • EndpointAddress

      The metadata address of the token issuer.

  • KeySize

    Gets or sets the issued token key size.

    public int KeySize { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      The size of the token key.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      An attempt was made to set a value less than 0.

  • KeyType

    Gets or sets the issued token key type.

    public System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyType KeyType { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • SecurityKeyType

      One of the SecurityKeyType values.

  • SupportsClientAuthentication

    When implemented, gets a value that indicates whether the token supports client authentication.

    protected override bool SupportsClientAuthentication { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the token supports client authentication; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    This property always returns true.

  • SupportsClientWindowsIdentity

    When implemented, gets a value that indicates whether the token supports a Windows identity for authentication.

    protected override bool SupportsClientWindowsIdentity { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the token supports a Windows identity for authentication; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    This property always returns false.

  • SupportsServerAuthentication

    When implemented, gets a value that indicates whether the token supports server authentication.

    protected override bool SupportsServerAuthentication { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the token supports server authentication; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    This property always returns true.

  • TokenType

    Gets or sets the issued token type.

    public string TokenType { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The token type.

  • UseStrTransform

    Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the issued token parameter uses STR transform.

    public bool UseStrTransform { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the issued token parameter uses STR transform; otherwise, false.

Methods

  • CloneCore()

    Clones another instance of this instance of the class.

    protected override System.ServiceModel.Security.Tokens.SecurityTokenParameters CloneCore ();

    Returns

    • System.ServiceModel.Security.Tokens.SecurityTokenParameters

      A SecurityTokenParameters that represents the copy.

    Remarks

    The Clone and CloneCore methods follow the Core design pattern.

    CloneCore is an abstract class that is overridden by CloneCore.

    The CloneCore method calls the IssuedSecurityTokenParameters constructor.

  • CreateKeyIdentifierClause(SecurityToken,SecurityTokenReferenceStyle)

    Creates a key identifier clause for a token.

    protected override System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause CreateKeyIdentifierClause (System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken token, System.ServiceModel.Security.Tokens.SecurityTokenReferenceStyle referenceStyle);

    Parameters

    • token
      SecurityToken

      The token.

    • referenceStyle
      SecurityTokenReferenceStyle

      The reference style of the security token.

    Returns

    • SecurityKeyIdentifierClause

      The security key identifier clause.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      token is null.

    • NotSupportedException

      referenceStyle is not External or Internal.

    Remarks

    Creates a key identifier clause using the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken.CreateKeyIdentifierClause%2A> method, with referenceStyle as a generic parameter.

  • CreateRequestParameters(MessageSecurityVersion,SecurityTokenSerializer)

    Creates a collection of issued token request parameter XML elements that get included in the request sent by the client to the security token service.

    public System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection<System.Xml.XmlElement> CreateRequestParameters (System.ServiceModel.MessageSecurityVersion messageSecurityVersion, System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer securityTokenSerializer);

    Parameters

    • messageSecurityVersion
      MessageSecurityVersion

      The message security version.

    • securityTokenSerializer
      SecurityTokenSerializer

      The security token serializer.

    Returns

    • Collection<XmlElement>

      A stem.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection`1 that contains XML elements that represent the request parameters.

  • InitializeSecurityTokenRequirement(SecurityTokenRequirement)

    When implemented, initializes a security token requirement based on the properties set on the IssuedSecurityTokenParameters.

    protected override void InitializeSecurityTokenRequirement (System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenRequirement requirement);

    Parameters

    • requirement
      SecurityTokenRequirement

      The security token requirement to initialize.

    Remarks

    The following properties of the SecurityTokenRequirement are initialized:

    • TokenType is set to the value in the current instance of this class.

    • RequireCryptographicToken = true.

    • KeyType is set to the value in the current instance of this class.

  • ToString()

    Displays a text representation of this instance of the class.

    public override string ToString ();

    Returns

    • String

      A text representation of this instance of this class.

    Remarks

    The method displays the name of this class, TokenType, KeyType, KeySize, IssuerAddress, IssuerMetadataAddress, IssuerBinding (if not null) and binding elements, and ClaimTypeRequirements (if not 0).
